question: 封建主義
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>主義</ja> is "-ism." Add that onto an ism that is <kanji>build</kanji>ing a <kanji>seal(ed) in</kanji> system, and you have <vocabulary>feudalism</vocabulary>. Why? Because with feudalism, power is sealed in with one group or one family. Nobody else can get in (until they are overthrown, anyways), making this <vocabulary>feudalism</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
